title: Methods of Theoretical Physics - Parts I,II - Morse and Feshbach
description:
Methods of Theoretical Physics - Parts I,II - Morse and Feshbach 1953 Edition

McGraw-Hill

THE classic text for applied mathematics. This is truly a work of art - with its clear explanations and its fantastic stereoscopic illustrations. Yes, it may be a little dated; and yes, it is definitely not an easy read; but its clarity of content and its sheer mathematical elegance make it more than worthwhile for any serious student of physics or engineering. And one thing is certain: anybody able to successfully complete and really understand the material presented in this book will have become VERY well versed in applied mathematics
